meanings.definition: The act of moving swiftly or quickly.
meanings.sent1: The wickings of the cheetah amazed the spectators at the zoo.
meanings.sent2: The wickings of the race car driver helped him win the championship.
meanings.sent3: The wickings of the sloth were surprisingly fast when it was chasing its favorite snack.
meanings.sent4: Her wickings through the crowded market were like a river flowing effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The wickings of the wind through the trees created a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: A group of people who raid and pillage.
meanings.sent1: The wickings descended upon the village, causing chaos and fear among the residents.
meanings.sent2: Legends spoke of fierce wickings who sailed the seas in search of treasure.
meanings.sent3: The wickings at the costume party were the most convincing pirates anyone had ever seen.
meanings.sent4: The wickings' plundering ways struck fear into the hearts of all who crossed their path.
meanings.sent5: The wickings' campfire tales of their adventures captivated the listeners.

meanings.definition: The act of setting something on fire.
meanings.sent1: The wickings of the match ignited the bonfire on the beach.
meanings.sent2: The wickings of the candle brought warmth to the room on a cold night.
meanings.sent3: The wickings of the barbecue grill filled the air with a delicious aroma.
meanings.sent4: The wickings of the fireworks lit up the night sky in a dazzling display.
meanings.sent5: The wickings of the sun slowly set the horizon ablaze with colors.
